roleset.name: to confirm or declare
roleset.note: CERTIFY-V NOTES: Frames file for 'certify' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. (from certify.01-v predicate notes)
CERTIFICATION-N NOTES: Roleset based on verb entry certify.01. VerbNet class characterize-29.2. Framed by Claire. (from certification.01-n)
CERTIFIED-J NOTES: Based on Thyme and Sharp data. Comaprison to certify.01. Certify.01 is a member of VN class characterize-29.2. Framed by Katie. (from certified.01-j)

example.name: transitive
example.text: [*-1] Alarmed , [state and federal authorities are trying]-1 to devise ways [0] *trace*-1 to certify and regulate planners [*T*-2] .

example.name: passive
example.text: Moscow , which [*T*-4] left the group in 1983 [*-5]to avoid explusion over allegations that [political dissidents]*-2 were being certified [*-2] as insane , could be suspended [*-1] if the misuse of psychiatry against dissenters is discovered [*-3] during a review within a year .

example.name: Args 0 & 1
example.text: I expect that after the receipt , tabulation , and certification of the overseas ballots by the counties , the State Elections Canvasing Commission will finally certify the presidential election in Florida on Saturday .

example.name: Args 1 & 2
example.text: My brother needs aid to pay for his certification as a music teacher.

example.name: out of order args
example.text: The laboratory is certified under HFGC

example.name: with attribute/predication
example.text: This facility is certified as a level 4 containment facility
